events.title: Environmental Justice People Power Gathering (VIRTUAL)
events.description:
The Environmental Justice team at Michigan United is meeting with the community again this month.  We have a plan to fight corporate polluters in 2023 and want your help!

We will provide updates on our Core City Concrete Campaign in Detroit as well as the AJAX and Clean Water Campaigns in Flint.

To celebrate Black History Month, the awe-inspiring Piper Carter will be with us this Thursday to lead the conversation on Environmental Racism. Piper Carter is a Detroit resident, an Arts and Culture Organizer and Hip Hop Activist with focus on Entertainment Justice, Environmental and Climate Justice, Education Justice, the Maker Space movement, and Food Justice, communities.
She is also the Host of the Piper Carter Podcast on Detroit is Different where she discusses Social Justice and Hip Hop to a world wide audience.

From Piper's discussion, we will connect the topic of Environmental Racism to the topic of Energy Burdens in our most oppressed communities.

With your help, we are going to take back the power! We can't wait to see you there.



(Artwork in Event Photo by Sergio Maciel and Provoke Culture)

events.title: Dundee Michigan Area Democrats with Representative Reggie Miller
events.description:
Representative Reggie Miller (D-31) will be at Social House 103 in Dundee on Saturday, February 25. Seating for this event opens at 11am.

### Social House 103
* 103 Cabela Blvd E
* Dundee, MI 48131
* [Map & Directions Here](https://tinyurl.com/4fu5aphu)

Democrats in the Dundee area have started organizing and building strong quickly! MCDP recognizes their efforts and wanted to join together to help keep the community connected with our elected officials. This also reminds people that we serve the entire county of Monroe. 

It's a casual way to network and get real-time answers from Reggie. If you are able to attend, please buy something from the menu to help support this local business.

We hope to see you there!

events.title: Crucial Conversations in the Black Community
events.description:
We're ending Black History Month with a very important event: "Crucial Conversations in the Black Community." Join us at the Liberian Association of Michigan (13300 Puritan, Detroit) on February 28 at 5:30 p.m. Topics will include Black Power, When Black Becomes Blue, and Internalized Racism. 

This event is being organized by Michigan United, ABISA, Liberian Association of Michigan, Uganda Community of Michigan, and Rock of Salvation Ministries.

events.title: County Committee Meeting
events.description:
Monthly business meeting of the County Committee.

Join us in the Board Chambers on the first floor. Enter through the doors of the Courthouse that face Monroe City Hall. The chambers are back to the left as soon as you walk in.

Signup not required, but will send out an automated reminder the day before.

events.title: MCDP Euchre Fun Night!
events.description:
Join us for a Euchre Fun Night!

Rounds of euchre, just for fun! No quarters or brackets required! Beginner and experienced players welcome. In fact, we'll have board and card games for those who want to participate but don't play euchre!

We'll be collecting non-perishable goods for the Midland Food Pantry so be sure to stuff the collection box and help those with food insecurity here in Midland County!

events.title: Meet Representative Jimmie Wilson Jr.  & Senator Jeff Irwin
events.description:
We need to show our Representatives that there is overwhelming grassroots support for the work that they do. Join us as we talk to Representative Jimmie Wilson Jr. (32nd District) and Senator Jeff Irwin (15th District) and find out what their priorities are for 2023 and how we can help.

If you haven’t heard of it, Swing Left is a national network that helps people find high impact ways to support Democratic candidates. We focus on the most flippable races as an important step towards ensuring the progressive change needed to create a more inclusive and equitable government and society.

events.title: Ingham County Democratic Party March Expanded County Committee Meeting
events.description: Join fellow Democrats for our monthly meeting. This month there will be no guest speaker as we will be devoting the bulk of the meeting to strategic planning for 2023 and 2024. Social time is at 6:00 PM and the meeting begins at 6:30 PM. The agenda and more can be found at: https://inghamdems.nationbuilder.com/documentation

events.title: Women at Work: Women's History Month Celebration
events.description:
Join us to honor Women’s History Month and celebrate the hard-working women of Oakland County, past, present, and future.  Engage in conversation with special guests and meet women of all ages from Oakland County.  

- Elected Officials
- Voter Registration
- Committees & Clubs
- Bagels & Coffee
- More!

events.title: Ingham County Democratic Party March Madness Friendraiser
events.description:
RSVP and/or donate at https://secure.actblue.com/donate/bballmadness

Come together and meet old and new friends as we watch the first Final Four game and celebrate the winners of our Men's and Women's brackets.

We will have pizza, snacks and sweets to enjoy together. Cash bar.  

The Ingham County Democratic Party is hosting the event. Proceeds will be used for our Ingham County Democratic Party STATE PAC intensive Get Out the Vote efforts to prepare for the Presidential Election.  

Checks can be made out to the Ingham County Democratic Party and mailed to PO Box 14333, Lansing MI 48901 and write March Madness on the memo line. 

You can also pay at the door if you do not want to donate now at https://secure.actblue.com/donate/bballmadness.

Questions, please call us at (313) 936-0785 and leave a message.

events.title: Not Above the Law: Trump Indictment Rapid Response
events.description:
*Rallies will be held at 5pm local time on the day the indictment process is announced. However, if the announcement of indictment is made after 2pm ET, the rallies will be held the following day at Noon local time. We will update the timing of this event if/ when an indictment occurs.*

Donald Trump and his co-conspirators must be held accountable for their criminal conspiracy to overturn an election they knew they lost and the violent attack on our country on January 6th. 

Voters in battleground states rejected election deniers and voted to protect our freedoms in the most visible 2022 midterm elections. But grave threats to our democracy and our freedoms continue. MAGA Republicans, who refuse to condemn Trump’s contempt for the Constitution, are using their control of the House of Representatives, the Supreme Court, and state governments to do anything to gain power to achieve their extreme agenda and take away our freedoms.

We must come together to protect our freedoms. Holding rapid response events following the potential upcoming indictments of Trump will show that Americans are standing up for our freedoms under attack by Trump and the MAGA movement.
